issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: Signifies completion of tasks, info requests, etc.
resolution.name: Completed

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

fields.description:
A new feature in eucalyptus 4.3 was to set selinux to enforcing from jenkins in QLM.  However, currently, if selinux is set to enforcing from Quick Launch Master Deployment, Calyptos deployment will not work because of cloud initialization failure.  Here is the initial audit analysis that shows what is needed to allow clcadmin-initialize-cloud to run.
{code}
[root@a-24 ~]# sealert -a /var/log/audit/audit.log 
 37% done'list' object has no attribute 'split'
100% done
found 2 alerts in /var/log/audit/audit.log
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------

SELinux is preventing /usr/sbin/eucalyptus-cloud from using the dac_override capability.

*****  Plugin dac_override (53.1 confidence) suggests   **********************

If you want to help identify if domain needs this access or you have a file with the wrong permissions on your system
Then turn on full auditing to get path information about the offending file and generate the error again.
Do

Turn on full auditing
# auditctl -w /etc/shadow -p w
Try to recreate AVC. Then execute
# ausearch -m avc -ts recent
If you see PATH record check ownership/permissions on file, and fix it, 
otherwise report as a bugzilla.

*****  Plugin catchall_boolean (42.6 confidence) suggests   ******************

If you want to allow eucalyptus to storage controller
Then you must tell SELinux about this by enabling the 'eucalyptus_storage_controller' boolean.

Do
setsebool -P eucalyptus_storage_controller 1

*****  Plugin catchall (5.76 confidence) suggests   **************************

If you believe that eucalyptus-cloud should have the dac_override capability by default.
Then you should report this as a bug.
You can generate a local policy module to allow this access.
Do
allow this access for now by executing:
# grep eucalyptus-clou /var/log/audit/audit.log | audit2allow -M mypol
# semodule -i mypol.pp


Additional Information:
Source Context                system_u:system_r:eucalyptus_cloud_t:s0
Target Context                system_u:system_r:eucalyptus_cloud_t:s0
Target Objects                Unknown [ capability ]
Source                        eucalyptus-clou
Source Path                   /usr/sbin/eucalyptus-cloud
Port                          <Unknown>
Host                          <Unknown>
Source RPM Packages           eucalyptus-common-java-4.3.0-0.24804.227.20160504g
                              itccf936a.el7.x86_64
Target RPM Packages           
Policy RPM                    selinux-policy-3.13.1-60.el7_2.3.noarch
Selinux Enabled               True
Policy Type                   targeted
Enforcing Mode                Enforcing
Host Name                     a-24.qa1.eucalyptus-systems.com
Platform                      Linux a-24.qa1.eucalyptus-systems.com
                              3.10.0-327.13.1.el7.x86_64 #1 SMP Thu Mar 31
                              16:04:38 UTC 2016 x86_64 x86_64
Alert Count                   61
First Seen                    2016-05-05 01:16:48 PDT
Last Seen                     2016-05-05 01:18:21 PDT
Local ID                      440b6bb7-d1c8-417c-a41a-58f2b08466b2

Raw Audit Messages
type=AVC msg=audit(1462436301.370:601): avc:  denied  { dac_override } for  pid=13178 comm="eucalyptus-clou" capability=1  scontext=system_u:system_r:eucalyptus_cloud_t:s0 tcontext=system_u:system_r:eucalyptus_cloud_t:s0 tclass=capability


type=SYSCALL msg=audit(1462436301.370:601): arch=x86_64 syscall=mkdir success=no exit=EACCES a0=2f5da00 a1=1ff a2=0 a3=7f837f9e7200 items=0 ppid=13175 pid=13178 auid=4294967295 uid=0 gid=0 euid=0 suid=0 fsuid=0 egid=0 sgid=0 fsgid=0 tty=(none) ses=4294967295 comm=eucalyptus-clou exe=/usr/sbin/eucalyptus-cloud subj=system_u:system_r:eucalyptus_cloud_t:s0 key=(null)

Hash: eucalyptus-clou,eucalyptus_cloud_t,eucalyptus_cloud_t,capability,dac_override

--------------------------------------------------------------------------------

SELinux is preventing /usr/sbin/eucalyptus-cloud from read access on the directory hsperfdata_root.

*****  Plugin catchall (100. confidence) suggests   **************************

If you believe that eucalyptus-cloud should be allowed read access on the hsperfdata_root directory by default.
Then you should report this as a bug.
You can generate a local policy module to allow this access.
Do
allow this access for now by executing:
# grep eucalyptus-clou /var/log/audit/audit.log | audit2allow -M mypol
# semodule -i mypol.pp


Additional Information:
Source Context                system_u:system_r:eucalyptus_cloud_t:s0
Target Context                unconfined_u:object_r:user_tmp_t:s0
Target Objects                hsperfdata_root [ dir ]
Source                        eucalyptus-clou
Source Path                   /usr/sbin/eucalyptus-cloud
Port                          <Unknown>
Host                          <Unknown>
Source RPM Packages           eucalyptus-common-java-4.3.0-0.24804.227.20160504g
                              itccf936a.el7.x86_64
Target RPM Packages           
Policy RPM                    selinux-policy-3.13.1-60.el7_2.3.noarch
Selinux Enabled               True
Policy Type                   targeted
Enforcing Mode                Enforcing
Host Name                     a-24.qa1.eucalyptus-systems.com
Platform                      Linux a-24.qa1.eucalyptus-systems.com
                              3.10.0-327.13.1.el7.x86_64 #1 SMP Thu Mar 31
                              16:04:38 UTC 2016 x86_64 x86_64
Alert Count                   1
First Seen                    2016-05-05 01:16:48 PDT
Last Seen                     2016-05-05 01:16:48 PDT
Local ID                      d03c9f09-4d04-4800-82e8-29e558666bd1

Raw Audit Messages
type=AVC msg=audit(1462436208.610:524): avc:  denied  { read } for  pid=12950 comm="eucalyptus-clou" name="hsperfdata_root" dev="dm-0" ino=67237922 scontext=system_u:system_r:eucalyptus_cloud_t:s0 tcontext=unconfined_u:object_r:user_tmp_t:s0 tclass=dir


type=SYSCALL msg=audit(1462436208.610:524): arch=x86_64 syscall=open success=no exit=EACCES a0=1fc7ae0 a1=20000 a2=0 a3=0 items=0 ppid=12947 pid=12950 auid=0 uid=0 gid=0 euid=0 suid=0 fsuid=0 egid=0 sgid=0 fsgid=0 tty=(none) ses=18 comm=eucalyptus-clou exe=/usr/sbin/eucalyptus-cloud subj=system_u:system_r:eucalyptus_cloud_t:s0 key=(null)

Hash: eucalyptus-clou,eucalyptus_cloud_t,user_tmp_t,dir,read
{code}

This ticket will probably need to be updated with other items that will need to be changed in selinux to allow deployment to occur.
fields.summary: clcadmin-initialize-cloud fails when selinux is set to enforcing

comments.body: Do you have the output of its attempt to initialize the new CLC?

[~gholms]:
Output of initialize attempt on CLC:

[~gholms]: The machine already has the allow policy applied, that's why it worked.

Fix Verified.

initialize cloud works when SELinux is enforcing. Testing using QLM and setting SELinux to enforcing. This enables SELinux to ENFORCING prior to installing and configuring eucalyptus.
